metadata.source: DBI Information Sheet G-01: Signature on Plans
metadata.signed_by: Tom C. Hui, S.E., C.B.O., Director
metadata.purpose: Defines who must sign plans submitted to DBI — 4 signature status categories based on project scope, occupancy, construction type, span, and valuation

exempt.description: Any Building Designer, Interior Designer, or unlicensed person may prepare and sign drawings

conditions.limits: Type V construction, ≤2 stories + basement, bearing wall spans ≤25ft, height ≤25ft

conditions.note: Cannot design multiple clusters of 4-unit buildings. Design per conventional design per CBC Chapter 23.

conditions.limits: Non-high-rise, contained on one floor, nonresidential occupancy, valuation ≤$400,000
scope: Interior wall and ceiling decorative materials
Low partitions ≤5ft 9in and fixtures (rails, counters, cabinets)
Non-fire-rated suspended ceiling systems (ASTM 635-04 / 636M-06) — except those providing lateral support
HVAC systems not part of smoke control in exempt building

conditions.type: Dwelling unit improvements in R-2/R-3 (non-exempt buildings)
conditions.limits: Within single dwelling unit, estimated cost ≤$150,000 per unit
scope: Other non-structural work (if SFBC 3401.10 seismic design not triggered)

conditions.type: Replacement in kind — non-structural elements in R-3
conditions.scope: Maintenance replacement (e.g., rear stairs of two-flat building)

conditions.note: Consult SFFD for plan submittal requirements

exempt.override_note: If any portion deviates from substantial compliance with CBC 2308 conventional framing, licensed architect or registered engineer required for that portion
exempt.structural_safety_note: If alteration to non-exempt building affects structural system or safety (Building Official determination), all plans must be prepared by State-licensed person

licensed_contractor.description: Any contractor holding valid CA license may perform
scope: All work permitted under Exempt Status
Shop and field drawings for work contractor has contracted or offered to perform
Design of systems and facilities necessary to completion of contracted work
licensed_contractor.authority: CA Business and Professions Code Chapter 9
licensed_contractor.limitation: Cannot design work to be installed by another person

registered_engineer_or_architect.description: CA-licensed Civil Engineer or Architect must prepare and sign all drawings

triggers.trigger: New building with structural steel frame or concrete/masonry floors, roof, or walls
New building with clear span exceeding 25 feet
Any new building not covered by Exempt or Licensed Contractor status
Alterations to buildings in G01-EA-01/02/03 — including tenant improvements and dwelling unit work not covered by Exempt/Contractor
Wall removal without replacement (e.g., open kitchen)
Suspended ceilings providing lateral support for walls and partitions
Complex work beyond Exempt/Contractor capabilities — Building Official determination

registered_engineer_or_architect.coordination_rule: Architect or engineer of record responsible for reviewing and coordinating ALL submittal documents including deferred submittals (SFBC 106A.3.4)
registered_engineer_or_architect.minor_alteration_exception: Minor alterations not affecting structural or safety components may be made by person under direction of design professional — with letter/email to DBI

special_status.description: Specialized designs for portions or components require design professionals qualified by licensing agency

items.item: Retaining walls over 4ft total height from bottom of footing
Rigid frames, trusses — structural steel or reinforced concrete
Special timber construction (trusses, stressed skin panels, glulam beams, columns, arches)
HVAC equipment (mechanical/electrical) >400 lbs mounted ≤4ft above floor

special_status.sffd_note: Items marked sffd_consult — consult San Francisco Fire Department for qualification requirements

first_sheet.requirement: Original signature + professional seal with registration number
first_sheet.additional: Sheet index of all sheets required on first sheet

remaining_sheets.requirement: Signature facsimile + professional seal with registration number acceptable

stamp_contents: License type: licensed architect, registered professional engineer, or licensed land surveyor
Name as licensed with the Board
For architects only: expiration or renewal date of license

electronic_signatures.rule: Opaque and permanent impression, or electronically-generated representation on documents. Signature may be applied electronically.

shop_drawings.description: Shop drawings increasingly incorporated into building design packages for construction submittals (glass fiber reinforced concrete, stone, precast wall panels, fire sprinklers, metal stairs, glazed curtain walls)
shop_drawings.dbi_acceptance_condition: Principal Design Professional of Record accepts primary responsibility for work indicated on shop drawings

acceptance_methods.description: Signed by Design Professional of Record per SFBC 106A.3.4.1
Review stamp + signature by Design Professional of Record + Professional signature of sub-contracting DP who prepared shop drawings

Review stamp + initials of DPoR (or designated employee) + letter from DPoR stating intent, purpose, and extent of review. Sub-contracting DP signature also required. Shop drawings for plan check review must be design drawings, documented as such.

shop_drawings.note: Approval of shop drawings occurs within permit or addendum containing the work
